knimeNode.name: Sequence BLAST+ (Local)
knimeNode.shortDescription: Supports local execution of NCBI BLAST+ executables (which must be installed separately)

fullDescription.intro:
Supports local execution of NCBI BLAST+ executables (which must be installed separately) and direct integration of the results into the KNIME workflow. Query sequences are obtained from the user-specified column and must be of a suitable type for the BLAST program configured. Similarly, the database to search is also a FASTA file (a BLAST index of the database will be made automatically if it does not already exist).
WARNINGS:
this node is tested with NCBI BLAST+ v2.2.26, other versions are untested
the node outputs string columns which must be converted to numeric columns. This ensure no error if a column has a strange value in it. Use the String to Number node for this.
fullDescription.option: Query sequences as contained within the specified column. Be sure to choose the right blast program for the type of sequence in the column!
The FASTA file which contains the similar sequences of interest. A BLAST database will be created automatically as required.
The software install location for the NCBI BLAST+ software installed on your computer. It is recommended that this be version 2.26+ or later, but earlier versions may work too.
blastp for protein queries against a protein database, blastn for nucleotide queries against a nucleotide database etc. More details can be found at the NCBI BLAST+ help
The cutoff e-value where hits will be unreported. Smaller value means fewer hits, 1e-5 is a good start.
How many CPU cores to keep busy at once: as a general rule use one less than the number of cores in your computer, typically 2-4. If unsure set to 1.
Ignore spurious alignments from low complexity sequence: DUST for nucleotide queries, SEG for protein.
Enter additional command line arguments for each BLAST here.

ports.inPort: Input table including a sequence column eg. from String2Sequence node
ports.outPort: High-Scoring Pair output with all TSV columns preserved
Sequences with BLAST hits will be output here with numerous tracks of BLAST results for further analysis.
